text: Sandra Ankobiah (born 18 May 1983) is a Ghanaian lawyer, TV host, entrepreneur and philanthropist. == Education == Ankobiah studied International and Commercial Law, with a specialising in World Trade, from the University of Buckingham (LLB, LLM) between 2005 and 2009. She returned to Ghana and studied at the Ghana School of Law from 2010 to 2012. In 2013 she became a Barrister at Law. == Entrepreneur == Ankobiah is the founder of TV production company, Emerald Paradise Enterprise. She is also co-founder of SN Media Learning Tree, a provider of practical media training in Accra. == Philanthropy == Ankobiah is the co-ordinator for The Legal Advocacy Foundation, an organisation that aims to educate the ordinary Ghanaian about their legal rights and obligations. In 2016, she was appointed by the Ministry of Youth and Sports as an ambassador for women’s football in Ghana. Ankobiah is committed to raising funds, increasing awareness and patronage of the women's game. == Accolades == 100 Most Influential Ghanaian Women 2016 (Women Rising) ==References== Category:1983 births Category:Ghanaian lawyers Category:Living people
title: Sandra Ankobiah
